snippet.textDisplay: An amazing Metroid clone and my Game of the Year in 2015, I look forward to replaying it on Normal difficulty (I very much recommend going with the still challenging Easy difficulty on a first playthrough, especially for the bosses). Playing AM2R got me in the mood for more. One thing I feel like ESA did awesomely was to provide challenging rooms/puzzles requiring to master the skills you learn, it made for some very memorably satisfying moments when you succeed.
snippet.textOriginal: An amazing Metroid clone and my Game of the Year in 2015, I look forward to replaying it on Normal difficulty (I very much recommend going with the still challenging Easy difficulty on a first playthrough, especially for the bosses). Playing AM2R got me in the mood for more. One thing I feel like ESA did awesomely was to provide challenging rooms/puzzles requiring to master the skills you learn, it made for some very memorably satisfying moments when you succeed.

snippet.textDisplay:
@Claudio Marcelo Basckeira I've gotten pretty far into the postgame but I still don't know how far it goes and some of what i've done even runs contrary to what I've read in a guide so I don't even know anymore haha

I love this feeling of being lost in adventure, plumbing the depths of a mystery.

snippet.textDisplay: @xSayPleasex Easy is by far the most sane choice to start with. Even then the bosses are punishing. And really the difficulty of these games is the bosses. If you expect to be challenged by the normal enemies you're barking up the wrong tree.
snippet.textOriginal: @xSayPleasex Easy is by far the most sane choice to start with. Even then the bosses are punishing. And really the difficulty of these games is the bosses. If you expect to be challenged by the normal enemies you're barking up the wrong tree.

snippet.textDisplay: Yeah unless you really want the bosses to be challenging easy is probably best for first time through.  I did normal but I'm into really hard platformers like Wings of Vi and Dustforce ;)
snippet.textOriginal: Yeah unless you really want the bosses to be challenging easy is probably best for first time through.  I did normal but I'm into really hard platformers like Wings of Vi and Dustforce ;)

snippet.textDisplay: I recommend playing it on Normal, and then on Hard. The game is easy.

snippet.textDisplay: I should probably finish it some time soon, maybe with some cheats / save-file manipulation. I started on 'Normal' difficulty and *really* enjoyed it until the bosses got insanely hard later on. And I'd rather finish it with some external help than never finish it.
